Geometry (pyrit.geometry)

The main part of the Geometry module is the class Geometry. It is responsible for the connection between Pyrit and Gmsh.

Main classes

Geometry(model_name[, mesh_version, ...])

PhysicalGroup(tag, dim[, name])

Class for physical group object that can be added directly to GMSH.

Classes for geometrical entities

0 Dimensional

Point(x, y, z[, mesh_size, physical_tag])

A class representing a point.

1 Dimensional

Curve(*points[, physical_tag])

A class representing a curve.

Line(point1, point2[, physical_tag])

A class representing a Line.

Circle(center_x, center_y, center_z, radius)

Class representing a circle.

CircleArc(start_point, end_point, center_point)

A class representing a CircleArc.

Ellipse(center_x, center_y, center_z, ...[, ...])

A class representing an Ellipse.

EllipseArc(start_point, end_point, ...[, ...])

Class representing an ellipse

2 Dimensional

Surface(ext_curves, *int_curves[, physical_tag])

A class representing a surface.

Rectangle(origin_x, origin_y, origin_z, dx, dy)

Class representing a surface.

3 Dimensional

Note

Not implemented yet.

Abstract classes

PrimitiveGeo(dim, physical_tag[, tag])

Abstract class for primitive geometry object that can be added directly to GMSH.

Geo(name[, origin_x, origin_y, origin_z, anchor])

Abstract class Geo.

BasicAnchor(value)

Basic anchors for Geo.
